summary: Small tool to remove all non vanilla files of the game based on previously prepared list in text file.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]This is a small tool which will remove all non vanilla files of a game based on previously prepared list from text file.[/size]
[size=3]The tool will basically work with [b][color=#00ff00]any game/folder[/color][/b] you like.[/size]


[font=Comic Sans MS][size=5]Requirements[/size][/font]

[list=1]
[*][size=3]Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6[/size]
[/list]

[font=Comic Sans MS][size=5]Instrucions[/size][/font]

[size=4]Creating [color=#bf9000]#VanillaGameFilesList.txt[/color]:[/size]

[list=1]
[*][size=3]Unpack GameFolderCleaner.exe anywhere you want.[/size]
[*][size=3]Run GameFolderCleaner.exe.[/size]
[*][size=3]Select your game root directory (or paste full path from clipboard)[/size]
[*][size=3]Click "Create vanilla list" button to create [color=#bf9000]#VanillaGameFilesList.txt[/color] in your game root directory.[/size]
[/list]
[color=#ff00ff][size=3]Obviously you have to have only vanilla files inside root game folder...
...or you can download #VanillaGameFilesList.txt from optional section for Skryim...
...or you can get list for game you are interested in from someone else.
[/size]
[/color][size=4]Cleaning game folder:[/size]

[size=3]After some time, if you decide to remove all mods/non-vanilla files from your game:

[/size][list=1]
[*][size=3]Unpack GameFolderCleaner.exe anywhere you want (or run it from previously unpacked location).[/size]
[*][size=3]Run GameFolderCleaner.exe[/size]
[*][size=3]Select your game root directory (or paste full path from clipboard)[/size]
[*][size=3]Click "Start processing" button[/size]
[*][size=3][color=#a4c2f4]OPTIONAL:[/color] Unselect any file you don't want to delete[/size]
[*][size=3][color=#a4c2f4]OPTIONAL:[/color] Tick checkbox to add unselected files to your [color=#bf9000]#VanillaGameFilesList.txt[/color][/size]
[*][size=3][color=#a4c2f4]OPTIONAL:[/color] Untick checkbox to clear Read-Only attributes from files before deletion[/size]
[*][size=3]Click "Delete!" button[/size]
[*][size=3]Confirm files deletion by clicking "Yes" in confirmation popup[/size]
[/list]

[size=3]You can also manually add any other file names to [color=#bf9000]#VanillaGameFilesList.txt[/color] you wanna keep in the future.
Everytime you click "Create vanilla list" button, [color=#bf9000]#VanillaGameFilesList.txt[/color] will be overwritten!!! (I have to add confirmation checkbox :))[/size]
[size=3]
Tool will look for all non-vanilla files and will display list of those files including full paths, so you can review and decide if you are ok with removal.[/size]

[size=3]
Future plans:

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]change the way how tool looks for files - CRC or MD5 checksum[/size]
[/list][list]
[*][size=3][s]add information about errors occured during removal[/s] - done[/size]
[*][size=3][s]add possibility to exclude files from removal in runtime[/s] - done[/size]
[/list]

[size=3]
Changelog:

v1.4
[list]
[*]files to delete dialog UI re-design
[*]added confirmation popup after you click "Delete!" button
[/list]
v1.3
[list]
[*]added possibility to add excluded from deletion file names to list of vanilla files
[*]added possibility to remove Read-Only attribute from file before deletion
[*]added popup with error messages occured during processing if any
[*]bug fixes
[/list]
v1.2
[list]
[*]added possibility to exclude files from removal in runtime (dialog which shows files to delete has checkboxes now, so you can deselect some files if you decide to leave them)
[*]minor bug fixes
[/list]
v1.1[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2]implemented #VanillaGameFilesList.txt creation inside the tool[/size]
[*][size=2]UI re-design[/size]
[/list]

[size=3]Inspired by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73080/?]Skyrim Folder Cleaner[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3433007]Nixsy[/url][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3433007]
[/url][size=1]He decided to leave his tool simple as it is, so I decided to make my own with more features...[/size]
author: DaXmAn
